title.rendered: Sue Smith: Net Worth 2023, Career Earnings, Horses

content.rendered:
Summary

  • About Sue Smith
    • Early Career
    • Professional Career
    • Horses
  • Sue Smith’s Net Worth in 2023
    • Career Earnings
    • Endorsements
  • Personal Details
    • Relationship Status
    • How old is Sue Smith?
    • What is her nationality?
    • FAQs About Sue Smith 

Sue Smith is a renowned rodeo contestant from Blackfoot, Idaho, who has made significant contributions to the sport of barrel racing. Born on May 7, 1955, she joined the Women’s Professional Rodeo Association (WPRA) in 1997.

Here you can follow Sue Smith’s net worth, career earnings, professional career, horses, relationship status, and more.

About Sue Smith

Sue Smith, born on May 7, 1955, is a renowned rodeo contestant from Blackfoot, Idaho, who has made significant contributions to the sport of barrel racing.

Early Career

Smith’s early career in training began when she was a teenager and received a donkey as a gift. She started riding English jumping horses and then worked her way to a position as an assistant racehorse trainer in the Northwest.

Professional Career

Smith’s professional career in rodeo has been marked by success and resilience. She qualified for her first Wrangler National Finals Rodeo (NFR) in 2009, after attending just 31 rodeos that year. Her initial goal had been to make her circuit finals and qualify for the winter building rodeos.

She has trained several successful horses, including Dashes Centerfold and Diamond Center, both of which have contributed to her achievements.

In 2023, Smith had a particularly successful year. She won several rodeos, including the Cheyenne Frontier Days Rodeo, where she set a new arena record in the final round. Other victories included the Cave Creek (AZ) Fiesta Days Rodeo, Lakeside (CA) Rodeo, Ogden (UT) Pioneer Days Rodeo, Snake River Stampede (Nampa, ID), and Poway (CA) Rodeo.

Smith’s career earnings through the 2023 regular season amounted to $105,644, placing her 14th in the 2023 World Standings.

Horses

Her two of the most notable horses are Dashs Centerfold and Diamond Center.

Dashs Centerfold, also known as “Centerfold,” is a 12-year-old sorrel mare. She has been a significant contributor to Smith’s achievements, including a record-setting finish at the Cheyenne Frontier Days Rodeo in 2023.

Smith and Centerfold rapidly climbed up the Women’s Professional Rodeo Association (WPRA) world standings in July of 2023, with wins in Nampa, Ogden, and Cheyenne, earning over $45,000 in a few short weeks.

Diamond Center, known as “Heff,” is a 7-year-old buckskin gelding. He is the offspring of Dashs Centerfold, resulting from an embryo transfer program.

Sue Smith’s Net Worth in 2023

As of 2023, Sue Smith’s net worth is estimated to be around $15 million.

Career Earnings

Through the 2023 regular season, Smith’s career earnings amounted to $105,644. In 2023 alone, she ranked 14th in the world standings, earning significant prize money from her numerous wins.

Endorsements

Smith has been sponsored by several companies, including Coats Saddlery, Iconoclast, Back On Track, Silver Bit Ranch in Aguila, Arizona, and Equine Pride Feeds.

Personal Details

Relationship Status

Sue was engaged to Kyle Edwards in 2009, but there is no information on whether they got married or are still together.

How old is Sue Smith?

Born on May 7, 1955, she is 68 years old.

What is her nationality?

She is American.

FAQs About Sue Smith 

What is Sue Smith’s net worth in 2023?

Her net worth in 2023 is estimated to be around $15 million.

How many times has she qualified for the Wrangler National Finals Rodeo (NFR)?

She has qualified for the Wrangler National Finals Rodeo (NFR) three times, in 2009, 2011, and 2023.
